meanings.definition: The state or quality of being integral.
meanings.sent1: The integrality of the team's effort was crucial for their success.
meanings.sent2: She understood the integrality of honesty in building trust.
meanings.sent3: The integrality of the puzzle pieces made the game challenging.
meanings.sent4: His speech emphasized the integrality of unity in times of crisis.
meanings.sent5: The integrality of the ecosystem was evident in the delicate balance of nature.

meanings.definition: The condition of being complete or whole.
meanings.sent1: The integrality of the project depended on all its components working together.
meanings.sent2: The integrality of the family bond was heartwarming to witness.
meanings.sent3: The integrality of the recipe required all the ingredients to be perfectly measured.
meanings.sent4: The integrality of the story unfolded gradually, revealing its depth.
meanings.sent5: The integrality of the plan ensured its success from start to finish.
